Anamika Shreevastava is a postdoctoral researcher at Caltech and an affiliate of NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory. Her research focuses on the intricate interplay between cities and extreme weather events. Using a combination of numerical weather modeling, remote sensing, and complex systems science, she investigates the emergence and impacts of extreme heat in cities worldwide.

## Education

- [PhD in Civil and Environmental Engineering]{.fw-bold} | Purdue University, IN, USA | 2016 -  2020
- [MS in Civil and Architectural Engineering]{.fw-bold} | Purdue University, IN, USA | 2014 -  2016
- [BTech in Civil Engineering]{.fw-bold} | Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee, India | 2010 -  2014
